summary: Paul Merson and Andros Townsend had a public disagreement after Merson criticized Townsend's inclusion in the England squad. Merson later admitted he was wrong when Townsend scored for England against Italy.  Despite this, Merson continued to criticize Townsend's performance for Tottenham, prompting a response from Townsend on Twitter.

Chelsea have made a formal offer to FC Tokyo for 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto.  If the deal goes through, Muto will join Chelsea's Dutch partner club Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season. Muto, who graduated with an economics degree two weeks ago, would be the first Japanese player to represent Chelsea.

A large-scale study found that babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be overweight as toddlers.  The study, which looked at over 12,000 healthy two-year-olds, found that one in five boys and one in ten girls were overweight or obese by age two.  Children who had taken antibiotics as babies were particularly likely to be overweight, and repeated prescriptions before age two also increased the odds.  While the study didn't prove a cause-and-effect relationship, researchers suggest antibiotics may contribute to childhood obesity by killing gut bacteria that normally consume some food, freeing up more calories for the body, and potentially increasing appetite.  


The study highlights the importance of judicious use of antibiotics in infancy.

A Queen's Guard slipped and fell on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard ceremony at Buckingham Palace. The incident was captured on video by a tourist and showed the guard losing his footing, dropping his rifle, and scrambling to his feet.  The Ministry of Defence declined to comment on the incident.

A&E, Lifetime, and History will simulcast a remake of the miniseries "Roots" in 2016. The original, which aired in 1977, drew over 100 million viewers. The new version will be more faithful to Alex Haley's novel and will consult scholars for historical accuracy. LeVar Burton, who played Kunta Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the remake. Producers hope to bring the story to a new generation of viewers in light of recent events like Barack Obama's presidency and the film "12 Years a Slave," as well as ongoing racial unrest.

Christopher Lawler, a former royal footman, is alleging that in 1978, on his first day working at Clarence House, he was assaulted by a group of male staff members who tried to force him into an orgy.  Lawler claims he was threatened into silence and left his job the same day. He reported the incident to the palace last year after news of a historical child abuse investigation broke, but was initially ignored.  Scotland Yard is now investigating the claims.  A retired royal aide, who was reportedly interviewed, denies involvement.

Oregon couple Jesse and Melissa Meek announced their pregnancy in a rap video set to the theme song from the 90s sitcom "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air." The video, which has garnered over 1.7 million views on YouTube,  features the couple rapping about their journey to parenthood.  They revealed their pregnancy news to loved ones far away through the video.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in the 1939 film "Gone With the Wind" sold for $137,000 at auction. The dress, a jacket and skirt ensemble, was featured in several key scenes, including Scarlett's encounters with Rhett Butler and an attack scene. The dress, originally slate blue-gray, has faded to light gray with age.  The dress was part of a larger collection of over 150 items from the film, owned by James Tumblin, a former Universal Studios hair and makeup department head.  Other notable items from the auction included a straw hat worn by Leigh ($52,500), a suit jacket and trousers worn by Clark Gable ($55,000), and a black bonnet worn by both Leigh and Olivia DeHavilland ($30,000).  "Gone With the Wind," based on Margaret Mitchell's 1936 novel, celebrated its 75th anniversary last year.  Hattie McDaniel, who played Mammy, became the first African-American actor to win an Academy Award.

A two-year-old boy fell approximately 10 to 12 feet into a cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his mother dangled him over the railing.  The boy's parents rescued him before emergency services arrived. He suffered minor injuries and is in stable condition at the hospital. The zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the family.

A deactivated speed camera, which was previously used to enforce a 30mph speed limit, has been re-angled to face a house in Birmingham.  The camera, along with approximately 300 others using outdated technology, was decommissioned in 2013.  Birmingham City Council is aware of the situation and will investigate, potentially removing the camera.  A pilot program using newer technology for speed enforcement is currently in development but this specific camera will not be included.
Usain Bolt will compete in the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2nd and 3rd as part of the Jamaican team.  He is healthy, fit, and ready to run.
Neymar and Dani Alves attended a Barcelona basketball game against Real Madrid, which Barcelona won 85-80.  Neymar also recently played for Brazil, leading them to a 1-0 victory over Chile.

Thousands of migrants, mostly from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria, are attempting to reach Italy by sea, leading to a surge in rescues by the Italian Coast Guard.  Over 10,000 migrants have arrived in Italy in the first three months of 2015, with over 2,000 rescued during the first weekend of April alone.  The International Organization for Migration (IOM) reports that at least 480 migrants have died at sea this year due to dangerous conditions and overcrowded vessels often abandoned by smugglers.  


There are concerns about a potential capsizing incident involving a boat carrying 550 migrants, but the Italian Coast Guard has not yet confirmed this.

Alexis Sanchez chose to join Arsenal over Liverpool last summer, a decision Arsene Wenger is happy about.  Sanchez has scored 19 goals for Arsenal this season and Wenger believes his qualities make him one of the best players around. Wenger acknowledges Liverpool's interest in Sanchez may have been leverage in negotiations for Luis Suarez's move to Barcelona.  Wenger also praises Brendan Rodgers for his work with Liverpool, particularly in adapting to the loss of Suarez and Daniel Sturridge.  Finally, Wenger denies any speculation linking him with a move for Liverpool's Raheem Sterling.

Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break the cycling world hour record on June 7th at London's Olympic Velodrome.  The current record of 52.491km is held by Australian rider Rohan Dennis.  Tickets for the event will go on sale on April 19th and the event will be broadcast live on Sky Sports.

Serena Williams won her singles match against Sara Errani in the Fed Cup despite struggling in the tough claycourt conditions.  The US team lost the overall match 3-2 after Williams and Alison Riske were defeated in the doubles rubber. This relegation to World Group II prompted Williams to acknowledge she needs to be better prepared for the claycourt season.

River Plate is interested in re-signing striker Radamel Falcao, who played for them from 2001 to 2009.  While acknowledging the deal is complicated, River Plate's vice president states they "dream of Falcao" and that the door is open for his return.  Falcao is currently on loan at Manchester United from Monaco, where he has struggled this season.

Pop star Ella Henderson, known for her vocals from her time on The X Factor, is now the face of Batiste's 2015 "Ready For It" campaign.  The campaign features Henderson in various hairstyles with a blurred city background.  This is Henderson's first brand collaboration and was launched with a TV ad featuring her single "Mirror Man".

A billboard thanking Officer Pablo Torres for his service was erected in Kenosha, Wisconsin, despite the fact that he is currently on leave pending an investigation into the fatal shooting of Aaron Siler, 26, who was shot after a vehicle and foot pursuit on March 14th. Siler's family and friends find the billboard disrespectful and are asking for its removal. The Kenosha Professional Police Association, who paid for the billboard, claims it was intended as a simple thank you to the community for its support. This incident follows another shooting by Torres ten days prior, where he shot Terry Knight, 66, who was armed with knives. That shooting was deemed justified by the District Attorney.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants near the Pakistan border. The fighting took place in the Iranian town of Negur and three militants were killed by Iranian forces.  The militant group Jaish al Adal, which is anti-Iranian and aims to thwart Iranian influence in Pakistan, claimed responsibility for the attack.  Jaish al Adal is a Sunni Muslim group that has targeted Shiites and has been blamed for previous attacks on Iranian territory. Iranian officials have asked Pakistani authorities to catch the surviving assailants and have criticized Pakistan for failing to control the militants. Pakistan condemned the attack and said it is investigating.

This article discusses a recent conversation in Japan's parliament about UFOs.  

Lawmaker Antonio Inoki, a former wrestler, asked the Defense Minister if fighter jets were ever scrambled to meet extraterrestrial threats and if research was being done into aliens. The Defense Minister responded that Japan's Air Self Defense Force has never encountered any UFOs believed to be from outer space.  


The article also mentions a previous discussion in 2007 about the legal ramifications of defending against an alien invasion.

A 35-year-old passenger named Jin Pai was injured at Hefei Xinqiao International Airport after breaking a toilet while standing on its rim. He was taken to the hospital for treatment of cuts on his leg and buttocks. Pai initially told his travel companions he was squatting on the toilet because he was worried about its cleanliness, but later claimed to police he was sitting when the toilet collapsed.  Authorities believe the incident was an accident and reminded the public that toilets are for sitting, not standing.

Kevin Rebbie, 56, of Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested and charged with sexually abusing a 15-year-old girl over a four-year period. He filmed her and others using a hidden camera in a bathroom, capturing footage of them undressing and showering. Rebbie admitted to filming several victims, including the 15-year-old girl, whom he specifically targeted with the camera. He uploaded the videos, some containing close-up images of children's genitalia, to his computer. Rebbie's preliminary hearing is scheduled for May 1st, and he is currently held on a $500,000 bail.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama's latest series of photos features fathers leaping into the air next to their daughters who are pictured looking directly at the camera with smiles. The photos are part of a book that roughly translates to "Daughter and Salaryman".  The photographer states the images allow fathers, who usually appear serious, to express their fun side.  The fathers are dressed in sharp suits while the daughters wear casual clothing.  The photos are gaining attention online for their unique concept.

Kevin Pietersen is pictured with his Surrey team ahead of the new County Championship season.  Pietersen was controversially dropped from the England team in 2014 by the former managing director, Paul Downton, who has since been dismissed. Pietersen is hoping to force his way back into the England team for the upcoming Ashes series.

Ze Maria, the coach of Romanian football club Ceahul Piatra Neamt, has been sacked for the second time in a week after a 2-0 loss to FC Botosani left his team in 16th place in the league standings, six points from safety.  He was initially sacked on Wednesday but reinstated the next day before being dismissed again on Saturday.

Radamel Falcao's loan move to Manchester United has been unsuccessful. He has struggled to score goals and is unlikely to be signed permanently. His former Monaco teammate believes he would have been better off staying at Monaco despite not being happy there.

A man wearing a distinctive cartoon mask robbed a dairy in east Christchurch on Saturday, demanding cash from the owner's daughter. He fled with the till and an estimated $1500 in cash. Police are asking for the public's help in identifying the suspect, who was described as very tall and wearing a fluoro orange sweatshirt.

Kaitlyn Granado, a 24-year-old math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, Texas, has been arrested twice for inappropriate relationships with students.  The first arrest was on March 19th for kissing a 15-year-old student and allowing him to touch her breasts. The second arrest, on Monday, was for having sexual relations with a different 15-year-old student on two consecutive nights in January. Granado was released on bail both times.  She is currently on administrative leave and is prohibited from working with students or being on school property.

A video showing a crocodile with a dead dog in its jaws swimming through a marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, has gone viral. The dog belonged to the local bike shop owner. The crocodile was seen for hours with its catch, shocking onlookers.  The incident occurred near a crocodile sanctuary 200 meters away.  American crocodiles, which can grow up to 6 meters long, are common in Puerto Vallarta and are increasingly living closer to humans due to urbanization.

Hull City are currently battling relegation, sitting just two points above the drop zone after a 2-0 defeat to Southampton.  Manager Steve Bruce believes they can still avoid relegation, despite a difficult run of fixtures coming up. He attributes their struggles to a number of key injuries throughout the season.  Southampton, on the other hand, moved up to fifth place in the table after the win, with Ronald Koeman having to address an issue with Sadio Mane attempting to take a penalty despite James Ward-Prowse being the designated penalty taker.

Ian Guffick, a teacher at Mitton Manor Primary School, was banned from teaching for at least two years for altering SATs exam papers. He asked pupils to change their answers and altered some himself, leading to the school's 2014 SATs results being annulled.  Guffick admitted to the allegations but claimed he only asked pupils to make their answers more legible. The panel found his actions dishonest but not fraudulent and acknowledged his remorse.

Anders Lindegaard, a Danish goalkeeper for Manchester United, is married to Swedish model Misse Beqiri.  Despite struggling for playing time at Manchester United,  he enjoys a happy personal life with his wife and son.  They married in Mauritius in 2014 and Beqiri frequently posts modeling photos on Instagram.  Lindegaard has been linked with a move away from Manchester United but no transfer materialized.

The iconic "YANKEES" letters that once illuminated Yankee Stadium failed to sell at a Sotheby's auction despite an estimated price range of $300,000 to $600,000.  Current owner, Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson, purchased the letters for an undisclosed amount in 2008 after the stadium's final game.  Jackson, who attended the auction,  hoped a new owner would cherish the piece of New York history.  In a separate auction, a New York Mets bullpen car from the late 1960s sold for $112,500, exceeding its estimated value of $20,000 to $30,000.

This article discusses Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers addressing recent incidents involving players Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe.  Despite pictures of Sterling inhaling nitrous oxide and Sterling and Ibe with shisha pipes surfacing, Rodgers has chosen not to discipline them. He emphasizes the responsibilities that come with being a professional athlete and acknowledges the difference in how "normal things" are perceived when framed in a professional context.  The article also mentions Liverpool captain Steven Gerrard's return to the squad after a three-match suspension and Rodgers' focus on leading Liverpool to their first FA Cup final under his management.  Rodgers believes that past near misses in the title race and Capital One Cup have prepared the team for this opportunity.

Mesut Ozil, an Arsenal midfielder, recently returned from international duty with Germany where he played well in a 2-0 win against Georgia. He missed Arsenal's last game against Newcastle due to illness but is expected to play against Liverpool. Ozil, who joined Arsenal from Real Madrid in 2013, has been in good form since returning from injury, scoring three goals and providing four assists. He is adjusting well to the demands of English football, enjoying the frequent matches.

Barcelona is very happy with manager Luis Enrique's performance this season.  Despite speculation about his replacement, president Josep Maria Bartomeu insists Enrique will remain in his position. Enrique, who signed a two-year deal last summer, is on track to win the La Liga title.  Bartomeu emphasizes Enrique's focus on the team's current success and the possibility of winning three trophies this season.  


Let me know if you have any other questions.

Jordan Henderson has agreed to a new long-term contract with Liverpool, worth around £100,000 a week, running until 2020.  This follows contract extensions agreed to by Daniel Sturridge and Philippe Coutinho. Henderson, who joined from Sunderland in 2011, has been a key player for Liverpool under Brendan Rodgers' management and is expected to be considered for the captaincy when Steven Gerrard leaves for LA Galaxy.

Filipe Luis wants to stay at Chelsea for the remainder of his three-year contract despite Atletico Madrid's interest in re-signing him.  He is happy at Chelsea and is focused on helping the team win the Premier League title.  Manager Jose Mourinho is demanding the team's full concentration for the remaining nine difficult matches.

Nathan Hughes was initially banned for three matches after his knee accidentally collided with George North's head while scoring a try.  Although the disciplinary panel deemed the action reckless, Hughes's appeal was upheld, overturning the ban.  The incident occurred on March 27th and resulted in North being knocked unconscious, the third time he had been knocked out in two months.  Hughes missed Wasps' Champions Cup quarter-final loss against Toulon as a result of the initial ban.  The appeal panel concluded that the incident was accidental and no foul play took place.

Wildfires in southeastern Siberia, started by farmers burning grass, grew out of control due to strong winds and spread, destroying dozens of villages.  Although the fires were contained, smoke from the blaze was carried by winds across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest, causing intense red sunsets in parts of Oregon, Washington, and British Columbia. This is because smoke particles filter out shorter wavelength colors from sunlight, allowing longer wavelengths like red and orange to penetrate the air more easily, especially during sunrise and sunset when light travels through more atmosphere. As the smoke dissipates, air quality will improve and the sunsets will lose their reddish hue.

Becky Schoenig's 2015 Ford Fusion was stolen from her driveway in Missouri. A month later, police found the car after a tip from a man named Mick Sexton who recognized it. The car was returned to Schoenig with customized red rims, detailing, and orange accents on the steering wheel. Instead of being upset, Schoenig humorously thanked the thieves for "pimping out" her car on Facebook.  She is now having the car professionally cleaned due to the smell of cigarettes and marijuana left inside.  Schoenig is also creating a smoothie called "Sexton on Wheels" at her restaurant to honor Sexton for finding her car.

Manchester City face a battle to qualify for the Champions League and could miss out on £500,000 bonuses per player if they finish outside the top four.  They are currently in fourth place, four points ahead of Liverpool, who could overtake them if they win their game in hand.  City's poor form has seen them lose seven games in 2015, including exits from the FA Cup and Champions League.  Manager Manuel Pellegrini admits they have "thrown it into the garbage" and need to improve to attract top players like Juventus' Paul Pogba.

Manchester United's Under 18s defeated Manchester City's Under 18s 1-0 in a "mini-derby" match.  The winning goal was scored by Callum Gribbin from a free kick.  The match was played at Altrincham's Moss Lane stadium and was free to attend.  


The result leaves United two points behind league leaders Middlesbrough with a game in hand. City, who were injury-ravaged, have now lost both matches in the Barclays Under 18s Premier League end-of-season play-off series.

Joe Hart praised Gianluigi Buffon, who earned his 147th cap for Italy, calling him a "legend of the game" and an inspiration. Hart, who earned his 50th cap for England in the same match, expressed his desire to continue learning and playing for both club and country.

Chipotle is partnering with Postmates to offer delivery in 67 cities, charging a 9% service fee on top of Postmates' delivery fees, which start at $5.  This move comes after Chipotle previously declined offers from other delivery services.  The fast-casual chain joins other franchises like Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King in tapping into the $70 billion food delivery market.

The parents of Martin Richard, the youngest victim of the 2013 Boston Marathon bombings, are asking the Justice Department to forgo the death penalty for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the convicted bomber. They argue that pursuing the death penalty would prolong their pain and subject their remaining children to years of reminders of the tragedy.  Instead, they support Tsarnaev spending the rest of his life in prison without parole and waiving his right to appeal.  They acknowledge the severity of the crime but believe it's time to move forward and heal.

A mystery billionaire commissioned a custom-built Boeing 747-8, costing an estimated £400 million, to be transformed into a luxurious private jet.  The plane, originally designed to carry 600 passengers, now accommodates the owner and dozens of guests with features like a master bedroom, multiple lounges, a dining room with an adjoining kitchen, a conference room, and an "aeroloft" with eight beds.  The interior design, created by Greenpoint Technologies, resembles a luxury hotel more than a typical airplane cabin.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying a Dragon spacecraft to the International Space Station.  While the launch and ascent were successful, SpaceX's attempt to land the first stage of the rocket on a drone ship for the first time was unsuccessful.  The Dragon will deliver over 4,300 pounds of supplies to the space station, including an espresso maker. After the crew unpacks the supplies, the Dragon will return to Earth carrying over 3,000 pounds of experiments and trash. This is SpaceX's sixth mission to the International Space Station.

Priscilla Presley will be a witness at the first wedding held at the new Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas.  The chapel, located at the Westgate Hotel, will host the winning couple chosen from a contest run by the Today show. The winning couple, announced on Monday, will be married on April 23rd. The prize package includes the wedding reception, a two-night hotel suite, airfare, and tickets to the Elvis Experience show. Priscilla emphasized that the chapel is a high-quality venue and not a place for Elvis impersonators.

Liverpool beat Newcastle 2-0 at Anfield, with goals from Raheem Sterling and Joe Allen.  This win is important for Liverpool as they are four points behind Manchester City in the race for Champions League qualification.  Jordan Henderson believes Liverpool can catch Manchester City despite recent disappointing results against Manchester United and Arsenal.

Roma defeated Napoli 1-0 at home, ending a four-month winless streak. Miralem Pjanic scored the only goal in the 25th minute. Roma goalkeeper Morgan de Sanctis made several key saves in the second half to secure the victory.  The win moved Roma into second place, four points ahead of Lazio. Napoli's winless streak was extended to five matches.

Doncaster Rovers and Fleetwood Town played a dull 0-0 draw in a League One match.  The short, 27-second highlight reel on Doncaster's YouTube channel only featured the kickoff, a goal kick, and the final whistle due to the lack of exciting action.

The passage describes the unique bond between a man named Roland Giroux and his pet blood parrot cichlid.  Giroux noticed the fish was being bullied by tank mates and removed them, then began interacting with the fish by hand-feeding and stroking it, leading to a close, trusting relationship. The fish now enjoys daily massages and playtime with Giroux, becoming distressed when he removes his hand from the tank.

This passage discusses Ben Stokes' return to the England cricket team after a wrist injury and his fiery personality.  

Stokes is praised for his aggression and ability to capture the imagination, but it is noted that his aggression needs to be controlled and channeled positively. 

The passage also mentions the debate about whether to play a second spinner, Adil Rashid, in place of Stokes or Chris Jordan.  England wants to play both Stokes and Rashid as much as possible to help them develop.

Wales' upcoming Euro 2016 qualifier against Belgium on June 12th at the Cardiff City Stadium is a sell-out with 33,000 tickets sold.  This match is a crucial one for both teams as they are currently tied for first place in Group B.  Wales' recent 3-0 victory over Israel has fueled high expectations for their qualification chances.  The Football Association of Wales (FAW)  received overwhelming ticket demand, leading to the sell-out at the Cardiff City Stadium.  The team prefers playing at the smaller Cardiff City Stadium over the larger Millennium Stadium.

England's Under-17 football team, the defending champions, have been placed in Group D for the upcoming UEFA European Championship in Bulgaria.  Their squad includes players from various Premier League clubs like Chelsea, Arsenal, and Liverpool. They will face Italy in their opening match on May 7th, followed by games against Holland on May 10th and Ireland on May 13th.

Manchester City are interested in signing 14-year-old Belgian talent Evangelos Patoulidis from Anderlecht. He is a highly regarded prospect who was previously pursued by Barcelona but chose to stay in Belgium to continue his studies. City are now in talks with Anderlecht to agree a transfer fee.

Vanessa Santillan, a 33-year-old transgender escort from Mexico, was found dead in a Fulham flat on March 28th after suffering injuries to her head and neck. A 23-year-old man has been arrested and bailed in connection with her death. Police are appealing for anyone who had contact with Miss Santillan in the hours before her death to come forward.

Dawn, a woman who has suffered seven miscarriages, appeared on The Jeremy Kyle show to accuse her friend Jamie of stealing £207 she had saved for a gravestone for her late son, Daniel.  Dawn suspected Jamie and his girlfriend Carol of taking the money and confronted them on the show.  A lie detector test revealed Jamie had taken the money. Jamie had previously sent Dawn a Facebook message confessing to the theft and blaming his girlfriend Carol. Dawn was devastated by the revelation and left the show in tears.

ISIS released over 200 Yazidis, mostly women and children, on Wednesday.  This follows a pattern of ISIS releasing smaller groups of Yazidis since their initial takeover of Yazidi towns in northern Iraq last summer.  The Yazidis are a religious minority who have faced historical persecution and were targeted by ISIS, who killed, captured, and displaced them.  The international community responded with airdrops, rescues, and airstrikes against ISIS.

Harry Kane, a Tottenham striker, is featured in a new animation highlighting his best goals and celebrations from the season. The animation, created by Copa90, uses still images to depict Kane's goals against Chelsea, Arsenal, and his debut goal for England.  Kane is nominated for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Year awards.

This article discusses Jamie Carragher's support for Brendan Rodgers despite Liverpool's recent struggles. Carragher believes Rodgers is the right manager for Liverpool and that the team will improve next season. He emphasizes the importance of good signings for the team's success.  The article also highlights Carragher's receiving a Beacon Award for his community work through his 23 Foundation, which provides coaching in schools in deprived areas of Merseyside.

A four-year-old boy named James Hayward had his plastic Nerf gun confiscated at East Midlands Airport security because it was deemed a security risk.  Although the gun was plastic and fired sponge darts, airport security performed a pat-down on James and demanded he surrender the toy. His father, Phil Hayward, criticized the airport staff's reaction as "over-zealous" and "ludicrous."  East Midlands Airport apologized for the inconvenience and offered to return the confiscated toy, stating that their security regulations, set by the government, prohibit items resembling prohibited items, including replica guns.  Upon returning from their holiday, James was bought a replacement toy gun.

A 31-year-old man from Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, identified as "Rich," posted an advertisement on Gumtree seeking a girlfriend or wife. He outlined his desired qualities, including being fit, attractive, non-drinker and non-smoker, reliable, honest, loyal, good around the house, a good cook, and great in bed. He also specified enjoying the outdoors but being a "princess when need to be."  He described himself as athletic, white, heavily tattooed, with brown hair and eyes, and stated he doesn't drink, smoke, or do drugs. He enjoys traveling, the outdoors, sports, and fishing. He owns property, is successful, and loves cars and bikes. He offered benefits like a company car, phone, and a gym membership to the successful applicant.  He stated he is not shy about spending money and is open to "reasonable offers."  He also mentioned that former partners need not apply.

FA chairman Greg Dyke is proposing to increase the number of homegrown players in Premier League squads from eight to twelve and change the definition of "homegrown" to mean training in England for three years before age 18, rather than 21.  Five former England managers (Taylor, Hoddle, Keegan, Eriksson, and McClaren) support these proposals, warning that rejecting them will harm English football and make it harder to win the World Cup. They point out that only 36.8% of Premier League starters in the last round of matches were eligible for England selection, and that the pool of English talent at the top level is shrinking.  Despite this, they cite the emergence of young players like Kane, Barkley, and Sterling as evidence that England can still produce talent, but they argue that these players are not being given enough opportunities.

The passage discusses the rapid progression of Demelza's pregnancy in the TV show Poldark.  Despite the previous episode ending with the announcement of the pregnancy, the next episode shows Demelza eight months pregnant and then giving birth within minutes. This quick timeline has been criticized by fans who point out the unrealistic speed of the pregnancy, comparing it to a similar instance with another character, Elizabeth, whose pregnancy also progressed quickly between episodes.

Leicester, currently bottom of the table, are three points from safety after two consecutive wins.  Their manager, Nigel Pearson, urges his team to focus on their own performance and not get caught up in the results of their relegation rivals. He believes their fate is in their own hands and they need to control their own destiny in the remaining games.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara swam nearly 14,000 miles, the longest mammal migration ever recorded, surpassing the previous record of 10,190 miles set by a humpback whale. Varvara's journey from Russia to Mexico suggests she may be an eastern gray whale, a species thought to be distinct from the endangered western gray whale. This discovery could mean the number of western gray whales is even lower than the estimated 150.

A landslide on Hokkaido Island, Japan, caused a section of seabed to emerge overnight, adding 1,000ft to the coastline. The new landmass, which is 1,000-1,640ft long and 100ft wide, rose 30 to 50ft above sea level.  Local residents reported no tremors or sounds preceding the emergence, and authorities do not anticipate further expansion. Geologists believe the landslide was triggered by melting ice and snow causing a section of land to drop, pivoting the underwater area into the air.

Gregory van der Wiel has stated he is happy at Paris Saint-Germain and has no plans to leave despite a recent disagreement with manager Laurent Blanc that led to him being dropped for a Champions League match.  He expressed his love for the club, the city, and his teammates, and his desire to sign a new contract.

Carlos Tevez has informed Juventus of his desire to leave the club this summer despite having a contract until the end of next season.  He aims to return to his former club Boca Juniors in Argentina.  While Juventus are reluctant to lose their top scorer, they have accepted Tevez's decision and are already looking for replacements. Boca Juniors president has confirmed they are close to finalizing the deal, but stresses Tevez must first terminate his contract with Juventus.

During a Champions League match against Porto, Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola ripped a hole in his trousers while celebrating his team's 6-1 victory.  Bayern Munich advanced to the semi-finals of the Champions League after a dominant performance that saw them overturn Porto's 3-1 first leg lead.

A three-vehicle crash on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale, involved ten people, including four children.  A 40-year-old man and a five-year-old boy were flown to Princess Alexandra Hospital in Brisbane with chest and shoulder injuries and chest pain respectively. A 27-year-old woman with arm injuries and a six-year-old girl with abdominal pain were also airlifted. Six others, including an infant and two young girls, were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries or for further assessment. One person was trapped and freed by firefighters using hydraulic cutting gear. The highway is closed with diversions in place.

This article discusses Arsenal midfielder Mesut Ozil's excitement over his new Apple Watch and compares it to the one worn by Michael Knight in the TV show Knight Rider. It also highlights Arsenal's upcoming match against Chelsea, where they trail by 10 points with six games remaining.  The article further focuses on Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere's return from injury and former Arsenal player Ray Parlour's belief that Wilshere's fitness is the key to him reaching his full potential.

Mark Clattenburg will referee the Manchester derby between Manchester United and Manchester City.  Despite sending off three players from both teams this season, Clattenburg has only shown two red cards in the Premier League this season, both to Manchester United players.  Manchester City captain Vincent Kompany is suspended for the match against Wales in June due to a red card he received during Belgium's match against Israel.

This article discusses Bob Katter's statement defending Billy Gordon, who was accused of domestic violence and withholding his criminal history, leading to his expulsion from the Queensland Labor Party. Katter, who is of Lebanese descent, accused the Queensland Government of assuming Gordon would resign due to his race, comparing him to a "black puppet on a string." This statement sparked criticism on social media, with some questioning Katter's terminology. Katter defended his statement, citing personal experiences with racism and stating he used the term "black puppet" to highlight the racial undertones he believes were present in the government's assumptions about Gordon.

Dayna Dobias, a 19-year-old from Illinois, was born with cerebral palsy. She uses dance videos to challenge stereotypes about people with disabilities and inspire others. This article describes how Denmark improved its cancer diagnosis system.  

Previously, Denmark had long wait times for diagnosis, especially for less obvious cancer cases.  

To address this, they implemented a three-route system:

1. **Fast-track for serious cases:** Patients with clear cancer symptoms are quickly diagnosed and treated.
2. **Diagnosis centers:**  Patients with unclear symptoms are seen at specialized centers for quick testing and diagnosis.
3. **"Yes-no" centers:** Patients with minor, unlikely-to-be-cancer symptoms receive quick tests to rule out serious illness.

These changes led to shorter wait times, better collaboration between doctors, and improved survival rates.  Wales is now learning from Denmark's model to improve its own system.

This passage describes Greenstone, a new device developed by Open Garden to enhance the functionality of their FireChat app. FireChat allows users to send messages and files without relying on internet or cellular data, creating a localized network between devices.  

Greenstone acts as a relay, extending the range of FireChat's network to cover larger areas and overcome the limitations of FireChat's current range of 200ft (61 meters).  It achieves this by acting as a "beacon" or "booster" for messages within a mesh network, ensuring secure and anonymous communication even in areas with limited or no connectivity.  

The passage highlights the potential applications of Greenstone in scenarios like airplanes, underground areas, and large gatherings where traditional networks can become overloaded.

This passage describes the release of the largest, most detailed map of dark matter ever created.  

The map, produced by the Dark Energy Survey (DES), covers 0.4% of the sky and was made using data from the Victor M. Blanco Telescope. It shows the distribution of dark matter by observing its gravitational effects on visible matter. 

The map reveals large filaments and voids of dark matter, which helps scientists understand how galaxies form. The ultimate goal of DES is to map 12.5% of the sky, creating a 3D map of dark matter and dark energy. This will help scientists understand the nature of dark energy, which is believed to be accelerating the expansion of the universe.

This passage describes a competition run by Direct Line called "Everyday Fix".  

The competition asked groups to design products that solve common everyday problems. 

The top three problems identified in a survey of 2,000 people were:

1. **Not being able to sleep** (46%)
2. **Losing your keys** (37%)
3. **Not being able to sleep** (35%)

The winning designs were:

* **Snooze:** An alarm clock that silences phone notifications to ensure a good night's sleep.
* **Forget Me Lock:** A device that attaches to a key and swivels to indicate whether a door is locked or unlocked.
* **Nipper:** The world's smallest phone charger, powered by any household battery.

The public can vote for their favourite product on Twitter using the #everydayfix hashtag. The winning product will be funded through a Kickstarter campaign and developed.

Wenger acknowledges Liverpool's interest in Sanchez may have been leverage in negotiations for Luis Suarez's move to Barcelona.  Wenger also praises Brendan Rodgers for his work with Liverpool, particularly in adapting to the loss of Suarez and Daniel Sturridge.  Finally, Wenger denies any speculation linking him with a move for Liverpool's Raheem Sterling.

Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break the cycling world hour record on June 7th at London's Olympic Velodrome.  The current record of 52.491km is held by Australian rider Rohan Dennis.  Tickets for the event will go on sale on April 19th and the event will be broadcast live on Sky Sports.

Serena Williams won her singles match against Sara Errani in the Fed Cup despite struggling in the tough claycourt conditions.  The US team lost the overall match 3-2 after Williams and Alison Riske were defeated in the doubles rubber. This relegation to World Group II prompted Williams to acknowledge she needs to be better prepared for the claycourt season.

River Plate is interested in re-signing striker Radamel Falcao, who played for them from 2001 to 2009.  While acknowledging the deal is complicated, River Plate's vice president states they "dream of Falcao" and that the door is open for his return.  Falcao is currently on loan at Manchester United from Monaco, where he has struggled this season.

Pop star Ella Henderson, known for her vocals from her time on The X Factor, is now the face of Batiste's 2015 "Ready For It" campaign.  The campaign features Henderson in various hairstyles with a blurred city background.  This is Henderson's first brand collaboration and was launched with a TV ad featuring her single "Mirror Man".

A billboard thanking Officer Pablo Torres for his service was erected in Kenosha, Wisconsin, despite the fact that he is currently on leave pending an investigation into the fatal shooting of Aaron Siler, 26, who was shot after a vehicle and foot pursuit on March 14th. Siler's family and friends find the billboard disrespectful and are asking for its removal. The Kenosha Professional Police Association, who paid for the billboard, claims it was intended as a simple thank you to the community for its support. This incident follows another shooting by Torres ten days prior, where he shot Terry Knight, 66, who was armed with knives. That shooting was deemed justified by the District Attorney.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants near the Pakistan border. The fighting took place in the Iranian town of Negur and three militants were killed by Iranian forces.  The militant group Jaish al Adal, which is anti-Iranian and aims to thwart Iranian influence in Pakistan, claimed responsibility for the attack.  Jaish al Adal is a Sunni Muslim group that has targeted Shiites and has been blamed for previous attacks on Iranian territory. Iranian officials have asked Pakistani authorities to catch the surviving assailants and have criticized Pakistan for failing to control the militants. Pakistan condemned the attack and said it is investigating.

This article discusses a recent conversation in Japan's parliament about UFOs.  

Lawmaker Antonio Inoki, a former wrestler, asked the Defense Minister if fighter jets were ever scrambled to meet extraterrestrial threats and if research was being done into aliens. The Defense Minister responded that Japan's Air Self Defense Force has never encountered any UFOs believed to be from outer space.  


The article also mentions a previous discussion in 2007 about the legal ramifications of defending against an alien invasion.

A 35-year-old passenger named Jin Pai was injured at Hefei Xinqiao International Airport after breaking a toilet while standing on its rim. He was taken to the hospital for treatment of cuts on his leg and buttocks. Pai initially told his travel companions he was squatting on the toilet because he was worried about its cleanliness, but later claimed to police he was sitting when the toilet collapsed.  Authorities believe the incident was an accident and reminded the public that toilets are for sitting, not standing.

Kevin Rebbie, 56, of Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, was arrested and charged with sexually abusing a 15-year-old girl over a four-year period. He filmed her and others using a hidden camera in a bathroom, capturing footage of them undressing and showering. Rebbie admitted to filming several victims, including the 15-year-old girl, whom he specifically targeted with the camera. He uploaded the videos, some containing close-up images of children's genitalia, to his computer. Rebbie's preliminary hearing is scheduled for May 1st, and he is currently held on a $500,000 bail.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama's latest series of photos features fathers leaping into the air next to their daughters who are pictured looking directly at the camera with smiles. The photos are part of a book that roughly translates to "Daughter and Salaryman".  The photographer states the images allow fathers, who usually appear serious, to express their fun side.  The fathers are dressed in sharp suits while the daughters wear casual clothing.  The photos are gaining attention online for their unique concept.

Kevin Pietersen is pictured with his Surrey team ahead of the new County Championship season.  Pietersen was controversially dropped from the England team in 2014 by the former managing director, Paul Downton, who has since been dismissed. Pietersen is hoping to force his way back into the England team for the upcoming Ashes series.

Ze Maria, the coach of Romanian football club Ceahul Piatra Neamt, has been sacked for the second time in a week after a 2-0 loss to FC Botosani left his team in 16th place in the league standings, six points from safety.  He was initially sacked on Wednesday but reinstated the next day before being dismissed again on Saturday.

Radamel Falcao's loan move to Manchester United has been unsuccessful. He has struggled to score goals and is unlikely to be signed permanently. His former Monaco teammate believes he would have been better off staying at Monaco despite not being happy there.

A man wearing a distinctive cartoon mask robbed a dairy in east Christchurch on Saturday, demanding cash from the owner's daughter. He fled with the till and an estimated $1500 in cash. Police are asking for the public's help in identifying the suspect, who was described as very tall and wearing a fluoro orange sweatshirt.

Kaitlyn Granado, a 24-year-old math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, Texas, has been arrested twice for inappropriate relationships with students.  The first arrest was on March 19th for kissing a 15-year-old student and allowing him to touch her breasts. The second arrest, on Monday, was for having sexual relations with a different 15-year-old student on two consecutive nights in January. Granado was released on bail both times.  She is currently on administrative leave and is prohibited from working with students or being on school property.

A video showing a crocodile with a dead dog in its jaws swimming through a marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, has gone viral. The dog belonged to the local bike shop owner. The crocodile was seen for hours with its catch, shocking onlookers.  The incident occurred near a crocodile sanctuary 200 meters away.  American crocodiles, which can grow up to 6 meters long, are common in Puerto Vallarta and are increasingly living closer to humans due to urbanization.

Hull City are currently battling relegation, sitting just two points above the drop zone after a 2-0 defeat to Southampton.  Manager Steve Bruce believes they can still avoid relegation, despite a difficult run of fixtures coming up. He attributes their struggles to a number of key injuries throughout the season.  Southampton, on the other hand, moved up to fifth place in the table after the win, with Ronald Koeman having to address an issue with Sadio Mane attempting to take a penalty despite James Ward-Prowse being the designated penalty taker.

Ian Guffick, a teacher at Mitton Manor Primary School, was banned from teaching for at least two years for altering SATs exam papers. He asked pupils to change their answers and altered some himself, leading to the school's 2014 SATs results being annulled.  Guffick admitted to the allegations but claimed he only asked pupils to make their answers more legible. The panel found his actions dishonest but not fraudulent and acknowledged his remorse.

Anders Lindegaard, a Danish goalkeeper for Manchester United, is married to Swedish model Misse Beqiri.  Despite struggling for playing time at Manchester United,  he enjoys a happy personal life with his wife and son.  They married in Mauritius in 2014 and Beqiri frequently posts modeling photos on Instagram.  Lindegaard has been linked with a move away from Manchester United but no transfer materialized.

The iconic "YANKEES" letters that once illuminated Yankee Stadium failed to sell at a Sotheby's auction despite an estimated price range of $300,000 to $600,000.  Current owner, Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson, purchased the letters for an undisclosed amount in 2008 after the stadium's final game.  Jackson, who attended the auction,  hoped a new owner would cherish the piece of New York history.  In a separate auction, a New York Mets bullpen car from the late 1960s sold for $112,500, exceeding its estimated value of $20,000 to $30,000.

This article discusses Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers addressing recent incidents involving players Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe.  Despite pictures of Sterling inhaling nitrous oxide and Sterling and Ibe with shisha pipes surfacing, Rodgers has chosen not to discipline them. He emphasizes the responsibilities that come with being a professional athlete and acknowledges the difference in how "normal things" are perceived when framed in a professional context.  The article also mentions Liverpool captain Steven Gerrard's return to the squad after a three-match suspension and Rodgers' focus on leading Liverpool to their first FA Cup final under his management.  Rodgers believes that past near misses in the title race and Capital One Cup have prepared the team for this opportunity.

Mesut Ozil, an Arsenal midfielder, recently returned from international duty with Germany where he played well in a 2-0 win against Georgia. He missed Arsenal's last game against Newcastle due to illness but is expected to play against Liverpool. Ozil, who joined Arsenal from Real Madrid in 2013, has been in good form since returning from injury, scoring three goals and providing four assists. He is adjusting well to the demands of English football, enjoying the frequent matches.

Barcelona is very happy with manager Luis Enrique's performance this season.  Despite speculation about his replacement, president Josep Maria Bartomeu insists Enrique will remain in his position. Enrique, who signed a two-year deal last summer, is on track to win the La Liga title.  Bartomeu emphasizes Enrique's focus on the team's current success and the possibility of winning three trophies this season.

Jordan Henderson has agreed to a new long-term contract with Liverpool, worth around £100,000 a week, running until 2020.  This follows contract extensions agreed to by Daniel Sturridge and Philippe Coutinho. Henderson, who joined from Sunderland in 2011, has been a key player for Liverpool under Brendan Rodgers' management and is expected to be considered for the captaincy when Steven Gerrard leaves for LA Galaxy.

Filipe Luis wants to stay at Chelsea for the remainder of his three-year contract despite Atletico Madrid's interest in re-signing him.  He is happy at Chelsea and is focused on helping the team win the Premier League title.  Manager Jose Mourinho is demanding the team's full concentration for the remaining nine difficult matches.

Nathan Hughes was initially banned for three matches after his knee accidentally collided with George North's head while scoring a try.  Although the disciplinary panel deemed the action reckless, Hughes's appeal was upheld, overturning the ban.  The incident occurred on March 27th and resulted in North being knocked unconscious, the third time he had been knocked out in two months.  Hughes missed Wasps' Champions Cup quarter-final loss against Toulon as a result of the initial ban.  The appeal panel concluded that the incident was accidental and no foul play took place.

Wildfires in southeastern Siberia, started by farmers burning grass, grew out of control due to strong winds and spread, destroying dozens of villages.  Although the fires were contained, smoke from the blaze was carried by winds across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest, causing intense red sunsets in parts of Oregon, Washington, and British Columbia. This is because smoke particles filter out shorter wavelength colors from sunlight, allowing longer wavelengths like red and orange to penetrate the air more easily, especially during sunrise and sunset when light travels through more atmosphere. As the smoke dissipates, air quality will improve and the sunsets will lose their reddish hue.

Becky Schoenig's 2015 Ford Fusion was stolen from her driveway in Missouri. A month later, police found the car after a tip from a man named Mick Sexton who recognized it. The car was returned to Schoenig with customized red rims, detailing, and orange accents on the steering wheel. Instead of being upset, Schoenig humorously thanked the thieves for "pimping out" her car on Facebook.  She is now having the car professionally cleaned due to the smell of cigarettes and marijuana left inside.  Schoenig is also creating a smoothie called "Sexton on Wheels" at her restaurant to honor Sexton for finding her car.

Manchester City face a battle to qualify for the Champions League and could miss out on £500,000 bonuses per player if they finish outside the top four.  They are currently in fourth place, four points ahead of Liverpool, who could overtake them if they win their game in hand.  City's poor form has seen them lose seven games in 2015, including exits from the FA Cup and Champions League.  Manager Manuel Pellegrini admits they have "thrown it into the garbage" and need to improve to attract top players like Juventus' Paul Pogba.

Manchester United's Under 18s defeated Manchester City's Under 18s 1-0 in a "mini-derby" match.  The winning goal was scored by Callum Gribbin from a free kick.  The match was played at Altrincham's Moss Lane stadium and was free to attend.  


The result leaves United two points behind league leaders Middlesbrough with a game in hand. City, who were injury-ravaged, have now lost both matches in the Barclays Under 18s Premier League end-of-season play-off series.

Joe Hart praised Gianluigi Buffon, who earned his 147th cap for Italy, calling him a "legend of the game" and an inspiration. Hart, who earned his 50th cap for England in the same match, expressed his desire to continue learning and playing for both club and country.

Chipotle is partnering with Postmates to offer delivery in 67 cities, charging a 9% service fee on top of Postmates' delivery fees, which start at $5.  This move comes after Chipotle previously declined offers from other delivery services.  The fast-casual chain joins other franchises like Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King in tapping into the $70 billion food delivery market.

The parents of Martin Richard, the youngest victim of the 2013 Boston Marathon bombings, are asking the Justice Department to forgo the death penalty for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the convicted bomber. They argue that pursuing the death penalty would prolong their pain and subject their remaining children to years of reminders of the tragedy.  Instead, they support Tsarnaev spending the rest of his life in prison without parole and waiving his right to appeal.  They acknowledge the severity of the crime but believe it's time to move forward and heal.

A mystery billionaire commissioned a custom-built Boeing 747-8, costing an estimated £400 million, to be transformed into a luxurious private jet.  The plane, originally designed to carry 600 passengers, now accommodates the owner and dozens of guests with features like a master bedroom, multiple lounges, a dining room with an adjoining kitchen, a conference room, and an "aeroloft" with eight beds.  The interior design, created by Greenpoint Technologies, resembles a luxury hotel more than a typical airplane cabin.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying a Dragon spacecraft to the International Space Station.  While the launch and ascent were successful, SpaceX's attempt to land the first stage of the rocket on a drone ship for the first time was unsuccessful.  The Dragon will deliver over 4,300 pounds of supplies to the space station, including an espresso maker. After the crew unpacks the supplies, the Dragon will return to Earth carrying over 3,000 pounds of experiments and trash. This is SpaceX's sixth mission to the International Space Station.

Priscilla Presley will be a witness at the first wedding held at the new Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas.  The chapel, located at the Westgate Hotel, will host the winning couple chosen from a contest run by the Today show. The winning couple, announced on Monday, will be married on April 23rd. The prize package includes the wedding reception, a two-night hotel suite, airfare, and tickets to the Elvis Experience show. Priscilla emphasized that the chapel is a high-quality venue and not a place for Elvis impersonators.

Liverpool beat Newcastle 2-0 at Anfield, with goals from Raheem Sterling and Joe Allen.  This win is important for Liverpool as they are four points behind Manchester City in the race for Champions League qualification.  Jordan Henderson believes Liverpool can catch Manchester City despite recent disappointing results against Manchester United and Arsenal.

Roma defeated Napoli 1-0 at home, ending a four-month winless streak. Miralem Pjanic scored the only goal in the 25th minute. Roma goalkeeper Morgan de Sanctis made several key saves in the second half to secure the victory.  The win moved Roma into second place, four points ahead of Lazio. Napoli's winless streak was extended to five matches.

Doncaster Rovers and Fleetwood Town played a dull 0-0 draw in a League One match.  The short, 27-second highlight reel on Doncaster's YouTube channel only featured the kickoff, a goal kick, and the final whistle due to the lack of exciting action.

The passage describes the unique bond between a man named Roland Giroux and his pet blood parrot cichlid.  Giroux noticed the fish was being bullied by tank mates and removed them, then began interacting with the fish by hand-feeding and stroking it, leading to a close, trusting relationship. The fish now enjoys daily massages and playtime with Giroux, becoming distressed when he removes his hand from the tank.

This passage discusses Ben Stokes' return to the England cricket team after a wrist injury and his fiery personality.  

Stokes is praised for his aggression and ability to capture the imagination, but it is noted that his aggression needs to be controlled and channeled positively. 

The passage also mentions the debate about whether to play a second spinner, Adil Rashid, in place of Stokes or Chris Jordan.  England wants to play both Stokes and Rashid as much as possible to help them develop.

Wales' upcoming Euro 2016 qualifier against Belgium on June 12th at the Cardiff City Stadium is a sell-out with 33,000 tickets sold.  This match is a crucial one for both teams as they are currently tied for first place in Group B.  Wales' recent 3-0 victory over Israel has fueled high expectations for their qualification chances.  The Football Association of Wales (FAW)  received overwhelming ticket demand, leading to the sell-out at the Cardiff City Stadium.  The team prefers playing at the smaller Cardiff City Stadium over the larger Millennium Stadium.

England's Under-17 football team, the defending champions, have been placed in Group D for the upcoming UEFA European Championship in Bulgaria.  Their squad includes players from various Premier League clubs like Chelsea, Arsenal, and Liverpool. They will face Italy in their opening match on May 7th, followed by games against Holland on May 10th and Ireland on May 13th.

Manchester City are interested in signing 14-year-old Belgian talent Evangelos Patoulidis from Anderlecht. He is a highly regarded prospect who was previously pursued by Barcelona but chose to stay in Belgium to continue his studies. City are now in talks with Anderlecht to agree a transfer fee.

Vanessa Santillan, a 33-year-old transgender escort from Mexico, was found dead in a Fulham flat on March 28th after suffering injuries to her head and neck. A 23-year-old man has been arrested and bailed in connection with her death. Police are appealing for anyone who had contact with Miss Santillan in the hours before her death to come forward.

Dawn, a woman who has suffered seven miscarriages, appeared on The Jeremy Kyle show to accuse her friend Jamie of stealing £207 she had saved for a gravestone for her late son, Daniel.  Dawn suspected Jamie and his girlfriend Carol of taking the money and confronted them on the show.  A lie detector test revealed Jamie had taken the money. Jamie had previously sent Dawn a Facebook message confessing to the theft and blaming his girlfriend Carol. Dawn was devastated by the revelation and left the show in tears.

ISIS released over 200 Yazidis, mostly women and children, on Wednesday.  This follows a pattern of ISIS releasing smaller groups of Yazidis since their initial takeover of Yazidi towns in northern Iraq last summer.  The Yazidis are a religious minority who have faced historical persecution and were targeted by ISIS, who killed, captured, and displaced them.  The international community responded with airdrops, rescues, and airstrikes against ISIS.

Harry Kane, a Tottenham striker, is featured in a new animation highlighting his best goals and celebrations from the season. The animation, created by Copa90, uses still images to depict Kane's goals against Chelsea, Arsenal, and his debut goal for England.  Kane is nominated for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Year awards.

This article discusses Jamie Carragher's support for Brendan Rodgers despite Liverpool's recent struggles. Carragher believes Rodgers is the right manager for Liverpool and that the team will improve next season. He emphasizes the importance of good signings for the team's success.  The article also highlights Carragher's receiving a Beacon Award for his community work through his 23 Foundation, which provides coaching in schools in deprived areas of Merseyside.

A four-year-old boy named James Hayward had his plastic Nerf gun confiscated at East Midlands Airport security because it was deemed a security risk.  Although the gun was plastic and fired sponge darts, airport security performed a pat-down on James and demanded he surrender the toy. His father, Phil Hayward, criticized the airport staff's reaction as "over-zealous" and "ludicrous."  East Midlands Airport apologized for the inconvenience and offered to return the confiscated toy, stating that their security regulations, set by the government, prohibit items resembling prohibited items, including replica guns.  Upon returning from their holiday, James was bought a replacement toy gun.

A 31-year-old man from Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, identified as "Rich," posted an advertisement on Gumtree seeking a girlfriend or wife. He outlined his desired qualities, including being fit, attractive, non-drinker and non-smoker, reliable, honest, loyal, good around the house, a good cook, and great in bed. He also specified enjoying the outdoors but being a "princess when need to be."  He described himself as athletic, white, heavily tattooed, with brown hair and eyes, and stated he doesn't drink, smoke, or do drugs. He enjoys traveling, the outdoors, sports, and fishing. He owns property, is successful, and loves cars and bikes. He offered benefits like a company car, phone, and a gym membership to the successful applicant.  He stated he is not shy about spending money and is open to "reasonable offers."  He also mentioned that former partners need not apply.

FA chairman Greg Dyke is proposing to increase the number of homegrown players in Premier League squads from eight to twelve and change the definition of "homegrown" to mean training in England for three years before age 18, rather than 21.  Five former England managers (Taylor, Hoddle, Keegan, Eriksson, and McClaren) support these proposals, warning that rejecting them will harm English football and make it harder to win the World Cup. They point out that only 36.8% of Premier League starters in the last round of matches were eligible for England selection, and that the pool of English talent at the top level is shrinking.  Despite this, they cite the emergence of young players like Kane, Barkley, and Sterling as evidence that England can still produce talent, but they argue that these players are not being given enough opportunities.

The passage discusses the rapid progression of Demelza's pregnancy in the TV show Poldark.  Despite the previous episode ending with the announcement of the pregnancy, the next episode shows Demelza eight months pregnant and then giving birth within minutes. This quick timeline has been criticized by fans who point out the unrealistic speed of the pregnancy, comparing it to a similar instance with another character, Elizabeth, whose pregnancy also progressed quickly between episodes.

Leicester, currently bottom of the table, are three points from safety after two consecutive wins.  Their manager, Nigel Pearson, urges his team to focus on their own performance and not get caught up in the results of their relegation rivals. He believes their fate is in their own hands and they need to control their own destiny in the remaining games.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara swam nearly 14,000 miles, the longest mammal migration ever recorded, surpassing the previous record of 10,190 miles set by a humpback whale. Varvara's journey from Russia to Mexico suggests she may be an eastern gray whale, a species thought to be distinct from the endangered western gray whale. This discovery could mean the number of western gray whales is even lower than the estimated 150.

A landslide on Hokkaido Island, Japan, caused a section of seabed to emerge overnight, adding 1,000ft to the coastline. The new landmass, which is 1,000-1,640ft long and 100ft wide, rose 30 to 50ft above sea level.  Local residents reported no tremors or sounds preceding the emergence, and authorities do not anticipate further expansion. Geologists believe the landslide was triggered by melting ice and snow causing a section of land to drop, pivoting the underwater area into the air.

Gregory van der Wiel has stated he is happy at Paris Saint-Germain and has no plans to leave despite a recent disagreement with manager Laurent Blanc that led to him being dropped for a Champions League match.  He expressed his love for the club, the city, and his teammates, and his desire to sign a new contract.

Carlos Tevez has informed Juventus of his desire to leave the club this summer despite having a contract until the end of next season.  He aims to return to his former club Boca Juniors in Argentina.  While Juventus are reluctant to lose their top scorer, they have accepted Tevez's decision and are already looking for replacements. Boca Juniors president has confirmed they are close to finalizing the deal, but stresses Tevez must first terminate his contract with Juventus.

During a Champions League match against Porto, Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola ripped a hole in his trousers while celebrating his team's 6-1 victory.  Bayern Munich advanced to the semi-finals of the Champions League after a dominant performance that saw them overturn Porto's 3-1 first leg lead.

A three-vehicle crash on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale, involved ten people, including four children.  A 40-year-old man and a five-year-old boy were flown to Princess Alexandra Hospital in Brisbane with chest and shoulder injuries and chest pain respectively. A 27-year-old woman with arm injuries and a six-year-old girl with abdominal pain were also airlifted. Six others, including an infant and two young girls, were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries or for further assessment. One person was trapped and freed by firefighters using hydraulic cutting gear. The highway is closed with diversions in place.

This article discusses Arsenal midfielder Mesut Ozil's excitement over his new Apple Watch and compares it to the one worn by Michael Knight in the TV show Knight Rider. It also highlights Arsenal's upcoming match against Chelsea, where they trail by 10 points with six games remaining.  The article further focuses on Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere's return from injury and former Arsenal player Ray Parlour's belief that Wilshere's fitness is the key to him reaching his full potential.

Mark Clattenburg will referee the Manchester derby between Manchester United and Manchester City.  Despite sending off three players from both teams this season, Clattenburg has only shown two red cards in the Premier League this season, both to Manchester United players.  Manchester City captain Vincent Kompany is suspended for the match against Wales in June due to a red card he received during Belgium's match against Israel.

This article discusses Bob Katter's statement defending Billy Gordon, who was accused of domestic violence and withholding his criminal history, leading to his expulsion from the Queensland Labor Party. Katter, who is of Lebanese descent, accused the Queensland Government of assuming Gordon would resign due to his race, comparing him to a "black puppet on a string." This statement sparked criticism on social media, with some questioning Katter's terminology. Katter defended his statement, citing personal experiences with racism and stating he used the term "black puppet" to highlight the racial undertones he believes were present in the government's assumptions about Gordon.

Dayna Dobias, a 19-year-old from Illinois, was born with cerebral palsy. She uses dance videos to challenge stereotypes about people with disabilities and inspire others. Dayna has faced bullying and stares due to her disability, but she wants people to see her as just like everyone else. She hopes her videos will encourage people to look past her disability and recognize her as an individual.  Dayna has also started motivational speaking at local schools.

Javier Hernandez, a Manchester United striker, is being pursued by several clubs including MLS side Orlando City, who are hoping to capitalize on his large Latin American fanbase.  Hernandez, who had a difficult loan spell at Real Madrid, also has interest from Premier League clubs (Southampton, Stoke, West Ham, Everton) and European clubs (Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio, Inter Milan).  Manchester United are willing to sell him for around £8million.  Meanwhile, Manchester United have made a revised contract offer to 19-year-old prospect Andreas Pereira, who has attracted interest from European clubs (Paris Saint-Germain, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven, Feyenoord) if he doesn't agree to terms with United.

Early Saturday morning, at a 76 gas station in South Los Angeles, a group of at least three people attempted to carjack a man who was pumping gas. When he ran away, they doused his white Dodge Charger with gasoline and set it on fire while two passengers were inside.  No one was injured, but the car was destroyed. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as arson and is using surveillance video to identify the suspects who remain at large.

Charles Manuel, a chiropractor from Lamoni, Iowa, surrendered his license after admitting to exchanging chiropractic services for sex with patients and performing exorcisms on them. Despite these actions, he received high patient satisfaction ratings on HealthGrades.com.  Manuel is barred from practicing in Iowa for at least 10 years.

The U.S. is protesting to Russia after a Russian SU-27 jet intercepted a U.S. RC-135U reconnaissance plane in an "unsafe and unprofessional" manner over the Baltic Sea. The Pentagon claims the Russian pilot performed aggressive maneuvers at a high speed near the U.S. aircraft. Russia claims the U.S. plane was flying towards its border with its transponder switched off, but the U.S. denies this. This is not the first time the U.S. has complained about such an incident involving a Russian SU-27 and a U.S. RC-135U, with a similar incident occurring over the Sea of Okhotsk a year ago.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle was stolen from a Marriott hotel parking lot in Salt Lake City. The rifle was secured in a case and chained to a truck safe but was stolen sometime overnight on March 27th.  Police believe the thief broke the car's window, used a rope to detach the case, and then drove away. The agent's other belongings were found at a nearby hotel, but the rifle remains missing. The theft occurred a week before President Obama's visit to Utah.

Luigi Costa, 71, is accused of murdering his neighbor, Terrence Freebody, in July 2012. Forensic psychiatrist Professor Paul Mullen believes Costa was suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse at the time of the murder, citing evidence of Costa's declining mental state in the lead-up to and during the attack.  The prosecution alleges Costa feigned memory loss during his interview with Professor Mullen, but the professor maintains that Costa was likely suffering from dementia for months or even years prior to the murder. Costa's mental state is crucial to the case, as a not guilty verdict could be reached if his unstable mindset at the time of the attack is proven.

Ross Barkley missed a penalty for Everton against Burnley despite Leighton Baines, the team's usual penalty taker, being on the pitch.  Martinez defended Barkley's decision, stating that he would have taken it if Romelu Lukaku had been playing.  Barkley's penalty was saved by Burnley goalkeeper Tom Heaton.  Everton won the game 1-0.

Two passengers were found dead in their stateroom on the ms Ryndam cruise ship in San Juan, Puerto Rico.  Holland America Line stated the incident appears to be a murder-suicide. Patrick Kluivert, former Dutch player and assistant coach, led Curacao to victory in the first round of 2018 World Cup qualifying.  They defeated Montserrat 4-3 on aggregate, after a 2-2 draw in the second leg and a 2-1 win in the first leg.  Curacao will now face Cuba in the next round.

Esteban Cambiasso, a veteran player with a trophy-laden career, believes keeping Leicester City in the Premier League would be as rewarding as winning any major trophy.  Despite Leicester's current seven-point deficit and lack of wins since January, Cambiasso remains optimistic about their chances of survival with a quarter of the season remaining. Cambiasso is content with his time at Leicester so far and is open to extending his stay beyond the current season.

Gemma, a 23-year-old mother of two, is at risk of being banned from seeing her children because of her excessive drinking, partying, and alleged theft.  She gave up her children at four months old and her mother, Debbie, has been raising them. Debbie is now considering banning Gemma from seeing the children after discovering she allegedly stole an iPad belonging to one of the children. This article describes how Denmark improved its cancer diagnosis system.  

Previously, Denmark had long wait times for diagnosis, especially for less obvious cancer cases.  

To address this, they implemented a three-route system:

1. **Fast-track for serious cases:** Patients with clear cancer symptoms are quickly diagnosed and treated.
2. **Diagnosis centers:**  Patients with unclear symptoms are seen at specialized centers for quick testing and diagnosis.
3. **"Yes-no" centers:** Patients with minor, unlikely-to-be-cancer symptoms receive quick tests to rule out serious illness.

These changes led to shorter wait times, better collaboration between doctors, and improved survival rates.  Wales is now learning from Denmark's model to improve its own system.

A large-scale study found that babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be overweight as toddlers.  The study, which looked at over 12,000 healthy two-year-olds, found that one in five boys and one in ten girls were overweight or obese by age two.  Children who had taken antibiotics as babies were particularly likely to be overweight, and repeated prescriptions before age two also increased the odds.  While the study didn't prove a cause-and-effect relationship, researchers suggest antibiotics may contribute to childhood obesity by killing gut bacteria that normally consume some food, freeing up more calories for the body, and potentially increasing appetite.  


The study highlights the importance of judicious use of antibiotics in infancy.

A Queen's Guard slipped and fell on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard ceremony at Buckingham Palace. The incident was captured on video by a tourist and showed the guard losing his footing, dropping his rifle, and scrambling to his feet.  The Ministry of Defence declined to comment on the incident.

A&E, Lifetime, and History will simulcast a remake of the miniseries "Roots" in 2016. The original, which aired in 1977, drew over 100 million viewers. The new version will be more faithful to Alex Haley's novel and will consult scholars for historical accuracy. LeVar Burton, who played Kunta Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the remake. Producers hope to bring the story to a new generation of viewers in light of recent events like Barack Obama's presidency and the film "12 Years a Slave," as well as ongoing racial unrest.

Oregon couple Jesse and Melissa Meek announced their pregnancy in a rap video set to the theme song from the 90s sitcom "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air." A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in the 1939 film "Gone With the Wind" sold for $137,000 at auction. The dress, a jacket and skirt ensemble, was featured in several key scenes, including Scarlett's encounters with Rhett Butler and an attack scene. The dress, originally slate blue-gray, has faded to light gray with age.  The dress was part of a larger collection of over 150 items from the film, owned by James Tumblin, a former Universal Studios hair and makeup department head.  Other notable items from the auction included a straw hat worn by Leigh ($52,500), a suit jacket and trousers worn by Clark Gable ($55,000), and a black bonnet worn by both Leigh and Olivia DeHavilland ($30,000).  "Gone With the Wind," based on Margaret Mitchell's 1936 novel, celebrated its 75th anniversary last year.  Hattie McDaniel, who played Mammy, became the first African-American actor to win an Academy Award.

A two-year-old boy fell approximately 10 to 12 feet into a cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his mother dangled him over the railing.  The boy's parents rescued him before emergency services arrived. He suffered minor injuries and is in stable condition at the hospital. The zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the family.

A deactivated speed camera, which was previously used to enforce a 30mph speed limit, has been re-angled to face a house in Birmingham.  The camera, along with approximately 300 others using outdated technology, was decommissioned in 2013.
